plugins.name: Disable "Clip content"
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the “Clip content” property on supported layers – either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
plugins.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off “Clip content” on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

133693.name: Disable "Clip content"
133693.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the “Clip content” property on supported layers – either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
133693.release_notes:
– Improved logging: the path to each modified clipsContent node is now printed in a structured, readable format with icons.
– Skipped clipsContent updates for INSTANCE nodes to avoid errors.
133693.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off “Clip content” on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

plugins.name: Quick Navigator
plugins.description:
Quick Navigator is a lightweight yet powerful plugin designed to help you stay oriented while working on large or complex Figma files. Instead of endlessly zooming and panning around, this plugin gives you a miniature view of your entire canvas thus making it easier than ever to find what you're looking for.


Features:

  1. See all your frames and sections in a simplified, scrollable mini window.
  2. Tap on any visible frame or section in the mini view to instantly select and focus it on the main canvas.
  3. Ideal when you're moving fast, experimenting, or managing chaotic canvases, no need for everything to be clean or structured.


NOTE: Currently, SVG shapes and text layers are not included in the mini view.
plugins.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!

131062.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!

plugins.name: Skeema
plugins.description:
What is Skeema?

Skeema is a Figma plugin that integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. It allows frontend developers and designers to access API schemas for specific design components, making it easier to align designs with backend structures and speed up the development process.


How does Skeema work?

It connects your Figma designs to the relevant API documentation. By clicking on a design element, you can instantly view the associated endpoint documentation, eliminating the need to search through long API docs.


Who is Skeema for?

This plugin is designed for frontend and backend developers, and teams who work with API-driven applications. It helps bridge the gap between design and development, making UI-based API integration and collaboration smoother and more efficient.


What are the key benefits of using Skeema?

  1. 🚀 Faster API integration: No more switching between tools. Get API docs directly inside Figma.
  2. 🎯 Better accuracy: Ensure your design components match the API structures, reducing development errors.
  3. 👩‍💻 Streamlined collaboration: Designers and developers stay aligned, minimizing back-and-forth communication.


Do I need technical skills to use Skeema?

While Skeema is built with developers in mind, it's intuitive enough for designers to use as well. Its UI is designed to seamlessly integrate into your existing Figma workflow, making it accessible for anyone involved in the design and development process.


What APIs does Skeema support?

Skeema is designed to work with OpenAPI (Swagger) specifications, but it can support a wide range of RESTful APIs. As long as your API has proper documentation, Skeema can link it to your Figma designs.


Is Skeema free?

Skeema offers both a free version with basic features and a premium version with advanced features such as team collaboration, extended API support, and priority access to updates.


Can I use Skeema with my team?

Yes! Skeema is built for collaborative teams. You can easily share API-linked designs with your development team, ensuring that everyone stays on the same page and works with the latest API documentation.
plugins.tagline: Skeema integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. Simply click to view docs.

plugins.name: Offgrid.fm
plugins.description:
Offgrid.fm is a lightweight Figma plugin that quietly monitors your design canvas and alerts you when someone is viewing your work without interacting. Whether you're collaborating on sensitive projects or just want more visibility into your workspace and helps you stay in control.


Key Features:

  1. Real-time detection of inactive observers
  2. Instantly identifies who's viewing your designs
  3. Helps protect your creative privacy and intellectual property
  4. Runs silently in the background without disrupting your workflow


Currently supports the Figma Web App only. *


Ideal for designers handling confidential work, remote teams, and creatives who value situational awareness in collaborative environments.
plugins.tagline: You've got eyes on you 👀

129513.name: Offgrid.fm
129513.description:

plugins.name: Sticky Note Maker
plugins.description:
Sticky Note Maker

Effortlessly add colorful sticky notes to your Figma designs. Perfect for annotations, feedback, and organizing ideas.


Key Features:

- Create sticky notes next to any selected frame (top-right) or centered in the viewport.

- Choose from 5 types: Note (blue), Fresh Idea (pink), Approved (green), Need Attention (yellow), Need Fix (red).

- Automatically includes your name and timestamp for easy tracking.

- Simple, icon-driven interface with color-coded hover and selection states.


How to Use:

1. Select a frame (or none for viewport placement).

2. Pick a sticky note type from the icon buttons.

3. Write your note and click "Create".


Ideal for designers, teams, and anyone who loves a visual way to comment and collaborate. Streamline your workflow with Sticky Note Maker!
plugins.tagline: Add colorful sticky notes to your designs. Perfect for annotations, feedback, organizing ideas.

plugins.name: Preview Card Creator
plugins.description:
Overview

Create a preview card from selected frames. The card contains images generated from the frames and a link back to the original Figma file allowing for easy navigation.


Why use this?

  1. Got summary or overview pages? This is useful for deeper linking into specific pages without having to be familiar with the file.
  2. Got a centralized file that contains the whole application? Stop the file from getting large by replacing full flows with a preview card that deep links to individual Figma files.
plugins.tagline: Create preview cards for summary or overview pages

125915.name: Preview Card Creator
125915.description:

  2. Got a centralized file that contains the whole application? Stop the file from getting large by replacing full flows with a preview card that deep links to individual Figma files.
125915.tagline: Create preview cards for summary or overview pages

plugins.name: SafeToSell - Trademark checker
plugins.description:
SafeToSell helps digital product creators, print-on-demand sellers, and e-commerce designers automatically scan their designs for active trademarks and forbidden keywords.


Simply select text elements from your Figma frame, and the plugin will instantly validate if they’re safe to sell on popular platforms like Etsy, Shopify, Printify, and more.


---


✅ Instant trademark scan

✅ Detect banned phrases before you publish

✅ Avoid copyright strikes, takedowns, or store bans

✅ Built for POD, digital goods, and e-commerce sellers


---


Whether you're designing T-shirts, wall art, digital downloads, or listing mockups, SafeToSell gives you peace of mind that your text won’t get flagged or removed.


Don’t risk losing your store — scan it before you sell it.
plugins.tagline: Instantly check your designs for trademarks and banned phrases before uploading.

plugins.name: Find & Replace Anything
plugins.description:
Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!


A powerful tool for finding and replacing styles! Works with components, instances and library styles. Especially helpful to align parameters across projects in bulk like auto layout or library styles for your pixel perfect design.


Plugin is in active development. Therefore, any feedback is appreciated! Like our plugin? Leave a heart!


Full feature list:


Library & local Styles

  1. Fonts
  2. Colors
  3. Effects
  4. Grids


Variables (search only)

  1. Color Variable
  2. Number Variable
  3. String Variable
  4. Boolean Variable


Shape & Frame

  1. Name
  2. Width
  3. Height
  4. Position X
  5. Position Y
  6. Rotation
  7. Constrain Proportions
  8. Clip content


Text

  1. Text
  2. Font Size
  3. Paragraphs Spacing
  4. Paragraph Indent
  5. Text Decoration
  6. Text Case
  7. Text Resizing
  8. Text Align Horizontal
  9. Text Align Vertical


Layer

  1. Blend Mode
  2. Opacity
  3. Visibility


Stroke

  1. Stroke Align
  2. Stroke Weight
  3. Stroke Join


Auto Layout

  1. Layout mode
  2. Spacing between items
  3. Paddings
plugins.tagline: Search for anything on your page and replace it with anything you want!

plugins.name: Postcard Generator Experiment
plugins.description:
This plugin is a study project for the Generative AI course at the Innopolis University.


It tries it's best to generate greeting cards by combining layout generation, user-uploaded photos, a custom AI-generated poem and a thematic AI-generated background.


To run, get a token at an https://openrouter.ai and place it as the only text block on an empty page.


For help feel free to write me at levada.andrew@gmail.com


Github — https://github.com/andrewlevada/postcard-generator-experiment
plugins.tagline: A study project: a couple of llm's trying their best to design

plugins.name: Little Bro
plugins.description:
Your Personal Design Mentor for Growth, Confidence, and Impact

Little Bro is the ultimate tool for designers who want to elevate their craft and make a real impact. Whether you're a junior designer, freelancer, or aspiring creative, Little Bro provides the mentorship and tools you need to thrive in your design journey.


  1. Instant Feedback on UX and Usability: Get real-time insights into your designs with usability simulations that help you identify pain points and improve user satisfaction.
  2. Accessibility Standards Made Simple: Ensure your designs are inclusive and meet accessibility standards effortlessly, making your work usable for everyone.
  3. Overcome Creative Blocks: Stay inspired and productive with strategies to spark creativity and keep your projects moving forward.
  4. Refine Your Presentation Skills: Learn to articulate your design decisions with clarity and confidence, helping you win over clients, teams, and stakeholders.
  5. Continuous Skill Development: With guidance refined by senior, staff, and director-level UI/UX and product designers, Little Bro helps you grow into the confident, skilled designer you aspire to be.


Little Bro is more than just a tool—it's your partner in mastering the art of UI/UX. From instant feedback to accessibility and usability insights, Little Bro is here to help you create designs that are not only beautiful but also functional and impactful.


Join a community of designers transforming their careers with Little Bro and unlock your full potential today.
plugins.tagline: A companion to help you design better, faster, and smarter

plugins.name: Arreglo
plugins.description:
https://arreglo.ai


Arreglo is a Figma plugin that helps music producers visualize song arrangements. Using AI with semantic pattern recognition, it generates musically intelligent arrangements based on your instrument patterns and track names, making it easy to plan and understand song structures.
plugins.tagline: Finish tracks faster with AI generated arrangement ideas!

plugins.name: DATVM
plugins.description:
DATVM makes it simple to inject realistic and varied data directly into your Figma designs, saving you time and keeping your mockups authentic.


100+ Built-in Datasets

Choose from a wide range of pre-populated categories.


Customizable Lists

Create and manage your own custom lists to perfectly match your project's specific needs.


Sort & Randomize

Sort data alphabetically, by length, or randomize for unique content every time.


Number Formatting

Format numbers with precision. Control decimal places, separators, currency symbols, and percentage variations.


Date Formatting

Easily format dates with customizable separators and order.


Bookmarks

Save your favorite lists for quick and easy access.


How it Works

  1. Select the text layers you want to populate.
  2. Open DATVM.
  3. Choose a data category from the available lists or select a custom list.
  4. Customize formatting options.
  5. Click to populate the selected layers with data.
plugins.tagline: Finest Data Populator

plugins.name: AVA Companion Plugin
plugins.description:
The AvaHub Batch Crop Importer plugin simplifies the design workflow by seamlessly importing crops generated by AvaHub.ai directly into Figma. AvaHub generates precise image crops, and this plugin allows you to batch import them effortlessly into your Figma workspace.


Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.
plugins.tagline: A tool to batch crop your ava images

115757.name: AVA Companion Plugin
115757.description:

Simply upload the JSON file generated by AvaHub, and this plugin will take care of the rest, preparing all your crops for use in your Figma designs. Ideal for designers who work with dynamic content or need to quickly integrate various image assets.
115757.tagline: A tool to batch crop your ava images

plugins.name: OxyReIcon
plugins.description:
OxyReIcon is the ultimate Figma plugin for designers and icon creators who want to streamline their workflow and create consistent, professional-looking icon sets effortlessly.


Key Features:

  1. Instantly create frames around your vector icons
  2. Customize background and icon colors with opacity control
  3. Automatically align icons in a customizable grid layout
  4. Resize icons and frames with precise control
  5. Convert framed icons back to vectors with a single click
  6. Save and load your preferred settings for quick access


Whether you're creating a comprehensive icon library, designing a cohesive UI, or preparing assets for development handoff, OxyReIcon has got you covered. Say goodbye to manual resizing and positioning – let our plugin do the heavy lifting so you can focus on what matters most: designing great icons.
plugins.tagline: Transform your vector icons into perfectly styled, grid-aligned frames in seconds.

103926.name: OxyReIcon
103926.description:
OxyReIcon is the ultimate Figma plugin for designers and icon creators who want to streamline their workflow and create consistent, professional-looking icon sets effortlessly.


Key Features:

  1. Instantly create frames around your vector icons
  2. Customize background and icon colors with opacity control
  3. Automatically align icons in a customizable grid layout
  4. Resize icons and frames with precise control
  5. Convert framed icons back to vectors with a single click
  6. Save and load your preferred settings for quick access


Whether you're creating a comprehensive icon library, designing a cohesive UI, or preparing assets for development handoff, OxyReIcon has got you covered. Say goodbye to manual resizing and positioning – let our plugin do the heavy lifting so you can focus on what matters most: designing great icons.
103926.tagline: Transform your vector icons into perfectly styled, grid-aligned frames in seconds.

plugins.name: Variables Management
plugins.description:
This plugin remaps variables between libraries inside the Figma variable table.


It’s useful when working with two connected libraries. If both libraries are duplicated for a new project, then the libraries remain connected to the original libraries.


This plugin can automatically remap those variable connections with a new library.


Currently it's maping the variables inside Figma's variable table only.

accepted.name: Moon Design System (Public)
accepted.description: Moon is a product design system that helps to kick-start your ideas much faster, maintain the integrity of user experience and optimise design and development.

plugins.tagline: Variables management for Figma libraries

plugins.name: colCheck - Color Usage Analyzer
plugins.description:
Zendeeps | colCheck - Color Usage Analyzer helps you understand the color distribution in your Figma frames. Select any frame, and the plugin shows:

•How many unique colors are used

•Which colors appear the most

•The percentage breakdown of each color


It scans fills, strokes, and effects to give you a quick overview of your color usage—perfect for design audits, cleanup, and maintaining consistency.


No setup required. Just open the plugin, click a frame, and see the stats.

accepted.name: Ruhul
accepted.description: Senior UX/UI Designer and Webflow Developer

plugins.tagline: Visualize your color usage at a glance.

135187.name: colCheck - Color Usage Analyzer
135187.description:

•How many unique colors are used

•Which colors appear the most

•The percentage breakdown of each color


It scans fills, strokes, and effects to give you a quick overview of your color usage—perfect for design audits, cleanup, and maintaining consistency.


No setup required. Just open the plugin, click a frame, and see the stats.
135187.tagline: Visualize your color usage at a glance.

plugins.name: Expression Blast
plugins.description:
As humans we feel. As humans we express.

We experience emotions like hunger, hangovers, confusion, or surprise. As designers especially, we often forget to eat, choosing instead to perfect one more button variation or tweak the kerning just a bit more—at the cost of sleep.

We feel so many things, yet have so few outlets to express them—whether we're collaborating with teammates or simply needing a small boost of joy. That’s why I created Expression Blast: a plugin that gives designers a playful way to express the real, everyday emotions we all experience.
plugins.tagline: An Outlet for Everyday Emotions.

134486.description:

plugins.name: another-data-populator
plugins.description:
Another Data Populator


A Figma plugin that populates your designs with JSON.


How it works


1. Create a Layer Group that contains at least one Text Layer. In the Text Layer content, use placeholders for you data fields in double curly brackets – such as {{firstname}} or {{lastname}}. The plugin will replace all these placeholders with respective data. _Please note that if your Text Layer is called {{name}} (in the Layer List), the content of the Layer will always be overwritten with the data contained in {{name}}. So if you use multiple {{placeholders}} in a Text Layer, you should rename your Layer to something without curly brackets._


2. In the same Layer Group, create a Shape Layer (this is your image placeholder). Give the Shape Layer a placeholder name in double curly brackets – such as {{image}}. The plugin will replace this placeholder with respective image data (PNG or JPG).


3. For JSON arrays, create a Layer Group with a placeholder name like {{items}}. That group must contain one child Group Layer with the name {{template}}. This is the group that will be cloned and populated with the JSON array data. This works recursively with nested data. The array placeholder can have an optional limit filter {{items | limit 5}}, which will limit the number of {{template}} clones.


Available Commands


Populate with Dummy JSON

The plugin includes presets from https://dummyjson.com/ including:


- Products

- Carts

- Recipes

- Users

- Posts

- Comments

- Todos

- Quotes


Populate with Imported JSON

You can also upload any JSON file from your machine.


Filters

By appending your {{placeholder}} with one of the following available filters, separated by a |, you can use certain operations on your populated strings.


1. Maximum characters

You can set the maximum number of characters of your {{placeholder}} by appending it with | max n, 'n' representing the desired number of characters.


{{name | max 3}}


2. Date

Display {{placeholder}} in MM/DD/YYYY format.


{{dateTimeString | date}}


Conditional Actions

A Conditional Action performs a certain action on a Layer Group or Component based on data and a conditional expression. The Conditional Action is controlled by the name of the Layer Group (or Component).


1. #show[condition]

shows layer if true and hides otherwise


2. #hide[condition]

hides layer if true and shows otherwise


2. #duplicate[condition]

duplicate layer n times


3. #variant[condition, component property]

set component property based on condition


Examples

#show[{{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} has more than 3 characters and hides otherwise


#show[{{firstname}} == "Peter"]

shows layer if {{firstname}} is 'Peter' and hides otherwise


#duplicate[{{rating}}]

duplicates the layer by the value of {{rating}}


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked]

sets the component property "Value Type" to "Checked" if {{completed}} is true


You can combine several conditions:


#show[{{firstname}}.includes('e') || {{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} includes 'e' or has more than 3 characters, hides otherwise


Or several Conditional Actions:


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked] #variant[{{completed}}, State = Completed]

sets the component properties "Value Type" to "Checked" and "State" to "Completed" if {{completed}} is true


Pure JavaScript syntax is being used for Conditional Actions, so you can basically use anything available in JavaScript.
plugins.tagline: Populate your designs with JSON

plugins.name: BorderBuddy
plugins.description:
Quickly inspect and update border radius values across selected frames in Figma.

BorderBuddy helps you speed up your workflow by displaying the current border radius of elements inside a selected frame, allowing you to adjust all values at once with a single click. Perfect for cleaning up inconsistent UI or testing design variations.
plugins.tagline: Quickly view and update the border radius of all elements within a selected frame in Figma.

133137.name: BorderBuddy
133137.description:
Quickly inspect and update border radius values across selected frames in Figma.

BorderBuddy helps you speed up your workflow by displaying the current border radius of elements inside a selected frame, allowing you to adjust all values at once with a single click. Perfect for cleaning up inconsistent UI or testing design variations.
133137.tagline: Quickly view and update the border radius of all elements within a selected frame in Figma.

plugins.name: Get Image Type
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that analyzes your selected images and reveals their file formats with a single click. Stop guessing if that asset is a JPG, PNG, SVG, or WebP.


Does not support:

  1. Video/Movie Files: This plugin does not support identification of video or movie formats.


Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.

accepted.name: Farren Wang
accepted.description: Farren's Figma account. Here you'll find stuff she's proud of.

plugins.tagline: Identify the format of images in your Figma designs

136900.name: Get Image Type
136900.description:

Does not support:

Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.
136900.tagline: Identify the format of images in your Figma designs

plugins.name: Pager
plugins.description:
Design-Ready File Templates in Seconds

Stop rebuilding your file structure every time.

Pager helps you spin up clean, structured Figma files with reusable templates built from your own component libraries or ours.


Whether you're starting a new product flow, setting up for research, or handing off to devs, Pager gives you a smart starting point so you can focus on design, not setup.


With Pager, you can:

Import full-page layouts from your published library components


  1. Use default templates for wireframes, UI, research, and more
  2. Create dynamic templates with text, boolean, and variant controls (Pro)
  3. Build faster with consistent, scalable structure


No setup? No problem.

Start from scratch or pick a default template.

Upgrade to Pager Pro anytime to sync your own library and automate your team’s workflow.


📚 View Documentation

🧩 Explore Example Templates
plugins.tagline: Go from blank canvas to design-ready in seconds.

plugins.name: Refine Selection
plugins.description:
Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma


Transform your selection workflow with this powerful tool that helps you select and deselect layers with precision. Perfect for designers who work with complex designs and need quick access to specific layer types.


Key Features:

• One-Click Selection: Instantly select all layers of a specific type within your current selection

• Alt+Click to Deselect: Hold Alt (or Option) to deselect layers instead of selecting them

• Smart Layer Detection: Automatically identifies and filters:

- Text layers

- All shapes

- Primitives (stars, polygons, lines, rectangles, ellipses)

- Paths

- Lines

- Image layers

- Frame layers

- Components

- Instances


Workflow Benefits:

• Save Time: No more manual selection of multiple layers

• Reduce Errors: Precise selection of specific layer types

• Smart UI: Buttons automatically disable when no matching layers are found

• Intuitive Design: Clean interface with visual feedback


Perfect For:

Designers working with complex layouts

Teams managing large design systems

Anyone who needs to quickly select specific layer types

Designers who frequently work with nested components


💡 Pro Tip: Hold Alt (or Option) while clicking to deselect layers instead of selecting them!


Note: Free version includes rate limiting of 50 selection per minute. Subscribe to remove limitations and support future development.
plugins.tagline: Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma

136478.name: Refine Selection
136478.description:
Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma


Transform your selection workflow with this powerful tool that helps you select and deselect layers with precision. Perfect for designers who work with complex designs and need quick access to specific layer types.


Key Features:

• One-Click Selection: Instantly select all layers of a specific type within your current selection

• Alt+Click to Deselect: Hold Alt (or Option) to deselect layers instead of selecting them

• Smart Layer Detection: Automatically identifies and filters:

- Text layers

- All shapes

- Primitives (stars, polygons, lines, rectangles, ellipses)

- Paths

Note: Free version includes rate limiting of 50 selection per minute. Subscribe to remove limitations and support future development.
136478.tagline: Refine Selection: Smart Layer Filtering for Figma

plugins.name: SliceView
plugins.description: Depths creates a stacked x-ray view of any layer in Figma. It separates and reveals each layer in depth order, making it easier to understand complex groupings, overlapping elements, and hierarchy at a glance.
plugins.tagline: Peek inside your layers. Visualize depth and stacking in your Figma selection.

129691.name: SliceView
129691.description: Depths creates a stacked x-ray view of any layer in Figma. It separates and reveals each layer in depth order, making it easier to understand complex groupings, overlapping elements, and hierarchy at a glance.
129691.tagline: Peek inside your layers. Visualize depth and stacking in your Figma selection.

plugins.name: Randomize
plugins.description:
How it Works:


Select Text Layers: Choose one or more text layers on your Figma canvas that you want to modify.


Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

129638.name: Randomize
129638.description:
How it Works:


Select Text Layers: Choose one or more text layers on your Figma canvas that you want to modify.


Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
129638.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

plugins.name: Layer Name Selector
plugins.description:
🔍 Finding the right layers in your design just got easier!


Layer Name Selector lets you define a scope (either the entire page or the selected area), choose specific layer types, and automatically select all matching layers with a single click.


Features:

1️⃣ Define scope: Work on the current page or only within selected elements.

2️⃣ Filter by layer type: Choose from Text, Instance, Component, Frame, Group and Rectangle.

3️⃣ One-click selection: Hit the "Select" button and let the plugin do the work!


Perfect for organizing large files, speeding up your workflow, and making precise edits in seconds. Try it out now! 🚀


☕️ Buy me a coffee
plugins.tagline: Quickly select layers by type and scope. Find what you need in seconds, effortlessly. 🔍

128032.description:

plugins.name: FileFlow
plugins.description:
FileFlow helps you instantly create organized file structures in Figma with predefined workflows for different project types.

Create consistent, well-structured Figma files without the tedious manual work. With FileFlow, you can:


Choose from pre-built templates for different workflows (Research, UI Design, Webflow, Product, Agency, and more)

  1. Create custom page hierarchies with intuitive organization
  2. Add sections and dividers to group related pages
  3. Use emoji icons to visually distinguish different page types
  4. Save time on project setup with one-click implementation


Perfect for teams that want to standardize their Figma file organization or individuals looking to streamline their workflow. FileFlow makes it easy to maintain clean, professional file structures that improve collaboration and productivity.


Tags

organization, workflow, file structure, pages, productivity, project management, templates, file setup

These details have been optimized for searchability while accurately describing what your plugin does. The description highlights key benefits and features that would appeal to Figma users looking for organization solutions. I've also included relevant tags that potential users might search for when looking for plugins like yours.
plugins.tagline: Organize your Figma files with custom page structures and workflows in one click

125079.description:

plugins.name: Smart Accessibility Checker
plugins.description: Ensure your designs are accessible and inclusive with the Smart Accessibility Checker! This Figma plugin scans for contrast issues, touch target sizes, font readability, and color-blindness concerns—helping you create user-friendly designs effortlessly. Get instant AI suggested insights and basic fixes to improve accessibility in real-time! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Design with Clarity: Smarter, Accessible, Inclusive 🚀

128248.name: Smart Accessibility Checker
128248.description: Ensure your designs are accessible and inclusive with the Smart Accessibility Checker! This Figma plugin scans for contrast issues, touch target sizes, font readability, and color-blindness concerns—helping you create user-friendly designs effortlessly. Get instant AI suggested insights and basic fixes to improve accessibility in real-time! 🚀
128248.release_notes:
🔧 Version 3.0 – Now with Auto-Fix!
We’re back with a powerful update! 🎉

🆕 What’s New in v3.0
✨ Auto-Fix for Font Size
Text nodes that fall below accessibility standards are automatically updated to a minimum readable size of 12px.

✨ Auto-Fix for Touch Targets
Interactive elements smaller than 48x48 px are now automatically resized to meet accessibility guidelines for tap targets.

These improvements help you stay WCAG-compliant with just one click. Perfect for speeding up your design workflow while ensuring usability for all.
128248.tagline: Design with Clarity: Smarter, Accessible, Inclusive 🚀
